title: Catholic Schools
description:
Catholic schools are educational institutions operated by or affiliated with the Roman Catholic Church. These schools combine rigorous academics with Catholic faith formation and values education.

Key characteristics of Catholic schools:

• Curriculum rooted in Catholic teachings and traditions
• Daily religion classes and regular Mass attendance
• Emphasis on service, social justice, and community involvement
• Strong academic programs often exceeding state standards
• Sacramental preparation (First Communion, Confirmation) often available
• Usually overseen by the local Catholic diocese

Catholic schools have a long tradition of serving diverse communities, including students of other faiths or no faith. Many Catholic schools offer substantial financial aid and participate in Florida's scholarship programs.

Florida's Catholic schools are coordinated through seven dioceses: Miami, Orlando, Palm Beach, Venice, Pensacola-Tallahassee, St. Augustine, and St. Petersburg.

When considering a Catholic school, ask about their religious education requirements, Mass attendance expectations, and policies for non-Catholic students.
